zone.line: the shape of man. They hold god, to be something
eternal & supreme, neither subject to change
nor to decay. Therefore they permit no statues
in their cities or their temples. Neither adulation
towards their kings, nor the honour due to Caesar,
in dues them to infringe this law. But, because
their priests sound the trumpet & the cymbal
crowned
& are bound with ivy, & because a golden
vine is found in their temples, some suppose
that they reverence Bacchus, the conqueror of the
East, with incongruous rites: for Bacchus
has instructed festal & joyous ceremonies, the
custom of the Jews is filthy & absurd.
The territory of Judaea is bounded by
Arabia on the South East: Egypt to
the South, on the West Phoenicia & the
sea, to the North it offers a broad
surface to Syria. The inhabitants are
healthy, & patient of labour; the soil is
fruitful; there are few showers. Plants
Such as such as ours are produced in profusion,
